Hyperlink.Description: I ripped code from two projects, fused and improved them. The sorting idea was ripped from Paul Tingey, his PropertySorter class. Globalization was ripped from Globalized Property Grid by Gerd Klevesaat. He, however, used inheritance from GlobalizationObject, which makes the mechanism not so flexible.

Hyperlink.Topic: Property Grid - Dynamic List ComboBox, Validation, and More
Hyperlink.Description: While working on a project, I was asked to include a PropertyGrid control to a screen to allow for configuration of equipment and to do validation. As I had not used a PropertyGrid control before, I started searching for examples, and was dismayed at what I was finding, or in the case of validation, not finding.

Hyperlink.Topic: How to create custom PropertyGrid editor item which opens a form?
Hyperlink.Description: I have a List<> (my custom class). I want to display a specific item in this list in a box on the PropertyGrid control. At the end of the box I would like the [...] button. When clicked, it would open up a form which, among other things, would allow them to pick one of the items from the List. When closed, the PropertyGrid would be updated to reflect the selected value.

Hyperlink.Topic: Getting the Most Out of the .NET Framework PropertyGrid Control
Hyperlink.Description: MICROSOFT MSDN - (Excellent starter resource) - The .NET Framework PropertyGrid control is core to the property browser that is in Visual Studio .NET. The PropertyGrid control displays properties for any object or type, and it retrieves the item's properties, primarily using reflection. (Reflection is a technology that provides type information at run time.)
DockPanel Suite Documentation, Ryan Rastedt, Lex Li, and others.

Hyperlink.Topic: Unit testing internals by Mark Seemann (Only unit test the public interface)
Hyperlink.Description: This question seems to come up repeatedly: I have some internal (package-private in Java) code. How do I unit test it? The short answer is: you unit test it as you unit test all other code: through the public API of the System Under Test (SUT). Also see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9122708/unit-testing-private-methods-in-c-sharp

Hyperlink.Topic: Better ListView Express (Visual Studio Gallery) - Extended Listview you should look at.
Hyperlink.Description: Managed ListView control replacement. Supports data binding, embedded controls, images in columns and more.

Hyperlink.Topic: How to: Stretch a ToolStripTextBox to Fill the Remaining Width of a ToolStrip (Windows Forms)
Hyperlink.Description: When you set the Stretch property of a ToolStrip control to true, the control fills its container from end to end, and resizes when its container resizes. In this configuration, you may find it useful to stretch an item in the control, such as a ToolStripTextBox, to fill the available space and to resize when the control resizes. This stretching is useful, for example, if you want to achieve appearance and behavior similar to the address bar in Microsoft® Internet Explorer.
This looks like it might be a newer version of the old Weifen Luo dock panel suite. Check it out for the future.

Hyperlink.Topic: dockpanelsuite: Focus tracking does not restore properly with floating panels. #21
Hyperlink.Description: We have a layout that updates tool windows whenever a dockpanel form is activated, notifying other dockpanels to clear their controls from the tool windows, which are reused. (Deactivates never seem to come in, so we went with a document declaring focus scheme).

Hyperlink.Topic: DockPanelSuite - Is there a way to prevent floating windows #233
Hyperlink.Description: I'm using a docking panel in a mdi form allowing docking. I need that the forms in the panel can only be moved between the docking positions so that they can never be floating.

Hyperlink.Topic: DocPanelSuite - How to recreate panels just like the last time after reopening the software? #286
Hyperlink.Description: DockSample project is your friend. It has an example how DockPanel.SaveAsXml(...) and DockPanel.LoadAsXml(...) is used. That will save and restore the original structure of the layout when it closed.

#develop (short for SharpDevelop) is a free IDE for C#, VB.NET and Boo projects on Microsoft's .NET platform. It is open-source, and you can download both sourcecode and executables from this site. In addition, you can find the latest information and changes on #develop, as well as get in touch with the team in the forum.
Check out the Avalon library.

AvalonDock is a docking windows control for WPF that lets you create customizable layouts using a full featured window docking system similar to what is found in many popular integrated development environements (IDEs) such as Visual Studio. It includes themes and samples to get you started.
